content:
This one's from the well-known advocate (and Duke researcher) Bray Patrick-Lake. Another case of six docs in five places, none of whom has her whole story, and serious med reactions that make her worry about accidents.

https://participatorymedicine.org/epatients/2020/01/patient-caregiver-letter-supporting-proposed-onc-rule-on-improving-flow-of-our-data.html/comment-page-2#comment-818835

This is important work, folks! Just creating & connecting the plumbing won't solve it, but it sure is the start.
Next: Another story of a 7-year-old's near death, and much repeated testing (cost, time, and the child's anguish) due to existing information not being at the point of need.

AND here's the most fascinating chart error I've ever heard of ...

A new doc invites patient to review her chart.

It says she arrested during long-ago surgery.

She says no, the surgeon got arrested - by the FBI - during the surgery!
